title: Lever arm ranking three pivot points on disk

content.question: A force <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math>, directed to the right, is exerted on a disk, as shown in the figure. The disk may pivot in the plane of the page about any one of the three labeled points, and the force results in lever arms of length <math alttext="L sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="L sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, and <math alttext="L sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math> for pivots at points <math alttext="A " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>C</mtext></math>, respectively. Which of the following correctly ranks <math alttext="L sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="L sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, and <math alttext="L sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="L sub A is greater than L sub B, which is greater than L sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="L sub B is greater than L sub A, which equals L sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="L sub B is greater than L sub A, which is greater than L sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="L sub C is greater than L sub B, which is greater than L sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="L sub B is greater than L sub A, which equals L sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
